command: # These are problems surfaced by checking for uses of newly deprecated
# This is a synonym for 'Bacteroides coprophilus JCM 13818'
# Solution: add a synonym, or re-curate.  (JCM 13818 not currently in Phylografter)
# We have an 'authority' 'Selysia prunifera (Poepp. & Endl.) Cogn.'.
# Study has 71,000 taxa - OTU editing is impossible due to performance
# Probably a synonym for "Crepidiastrum keiskeanum" which is in NCBI
# ... as evidenced by the NCBI id ... this suggests we ought to be
# trying hard to map unmapped names using NCBI ids ...
# This one is an order (in class Magnoliopsida).  Why would a curator
# map an OTU to an order?  Study is from a book published in 2000.
# Contained two families: Fumariaceae - now placed in Ranunculales (399)
# This one is in gbif as a synonym from CoL.  What's the problem with it?
# Ah! It's now a synonym for a variety.
# This one occurs as 'Solanum quitoense' gbif:6403105 study 227
# Stellaria is an IRMNG genus at top level in Metazoa.
# Need to look at study to see which of seven different taxa named Stellaria is intended.
# OTT 2.0 has two different ids for this taxon.  This occurrence needs to be replaced by 5154524
# This id used to be for the fungus genus name.  Now according to GBIF Drosophila (fungus) is a synonym
# Woodwardia = gbif:3267536 = ncbi:29603 is an annelid.
# Looks like there used to be 2 GBIF ids, one became a synonym (for the annelid),
# now there's only one accepted (a plant).
